You are given a string of even length $n$ consisting of lowercase letters.  You can rearrange the letters to form a new string that is antipalindromic (meaning the first and last letters are different, the second and second-to-last letters are different, and so on).  Each letter in the original string has a beauty value associated with it.  

Find the maximum possible sum of beauty values for a valid antipalindromic rearrangement of the string.

You are given a string of even length that can be rearranged to form a special type of palindrome.  The "special" part is that the first and last characters, the second and second-to-last characters, and so on, must be different.  

You are also given a list of values associated with each character in the string.  

Find the arrangement of the string that results in the highest possible sum of these values.
